li.klass.fhem.billing.playstore
Class PlayStoreResponseHandler

java.lang.Object
  li.klass.fhem.billing.playstore.PlayStoreResponseHandler

public class PlayStoreResponseHandler
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains the methods that handle responses from Android Market. The implementation of these methods is specific to a particular application. The methods in this example update the database and, if the main application has registered a PlayStorePurchaseObserver, will also update the UI. An application might also want to forward some responses on to its own server, and that could be done here (in a background thread) but this example does not do that. You should modify and obfuscate this code before using it.

checkBillingSupportedResponse

public static void checkBillingSupportedResponse(boolean supported)
Notifies the application of the availability of the MarketBillingService. This method is called in response to the application calling PlayStoreBillingService.checkBillingSupported().

Parameters:
supported - true if in-app billing is supported.

buyPageIntentResponse

public static void buyPageIntentResponse(android.app.PendingIntent pendingIntent,
                                         android.content.Intent intent)
Starts a new activity for the user to buy an item for sale. This method forwards the intent on to the PlayStorePurchaseObserver (if it exists) because we need to start the activity on the activity stack of the application.

Parameters:
pendingIntent - a PendingIntent that we received from Android Market that will create the new buy page activity
intent - an intent containing a request id in an extra field that will be passed to the buy page activity when it is created

purchaseResponse

public static void purchaseResponse(android.content.Context context,
                                    BillingConstants.PurchaseState purchaseState,
                                    java.lang.String productId,
                                    java.lang.String orderId,
                                    long purchaseTime,
                                    java.lang.String developerPayload)
Notifies the application of purchase state changes. The application can offer an item for sale to the user via PlayStoreBillingService.requestPurchase(java.lang.String, java.lang.String). The PlayStoreBillingService calls this method after it gets the response. Another way this method can be called is if the user bought something on another device running this same app. Then Android Market notifies the other devices that the user has purchased an item, in which case the PlayStoreBillingService will also call this method. Finally, this method can be called if the item was refunded.

Parameters:
purchaseState - the state of the purchase request (PURCHASED, CANCELED, or REFUNDED)
productId - a string identifying a product for sale
orderId - a string identifying the order
purchaseTime - the time the product was purchased, in milliseconds since the epoch (Jan 1, 1970)
developerPayload - the developer provided "payload" associated with the order

responseCodeReceived

public static void responseCodeReceived(android.content.Context context,
                                        PlayStoreBillingService.RequestPurchase request,
                                        BillingConstants.ResponseCode responseCode)
This is called when we receive a response code from Android Market for a RequestPurchase request that we made. This is used for reporting various errors and also for acknowledging that an order was sent successfully to the server. This is NOT used for any purchase state changes. All purchase state changes are received in the PlayStoreBillingReceiver and are handled in PlayStoreSecurity.verifyPurchase(String, String).

Parameters:
context - the context
request - the RequestPurchase request for which we received a response code
responseCode - a response code from Market to indicate the state of the request

responseCodeReceived

public static void responseCodeReceived(android.content.Context context,
                                        PlayStoreBillingService.RestoreTransactions request,
                                        BillingConstants.ResponseCode responseCode)
This is called when we receive a response code from Android Market for a RestoreTransactions request.

Parameters:
context - the context
request - the RestoreTransactions request for which we received a response code
responseCode - a response code from Market to indicate the state of the request
